definition: lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
basket for carrying soil

sentences.english: Will the Lakers three-peat, or will they fall short?
sentences.chinese: 湖人是會三連冠，還是會功虧一簣？

sentences.english: Any leak would have ruined the entire mission.
sentences.chinese: 只要當中任何一個人泄露，整個任務就會功虧一簣。

sentences.english: What if this and that happens which completely ruins all of your efforts?
sentences.chinese: 如果某件事讓你的努力功虧一簣怎麼辦呢？

sentences.english: The fall short of players named wang, 007.
sentences.chinese: 這位功虧一簣的007號隊員名叫王星。

sentences.english: Just one hiccup could destroy a carving in progress.
sentences.chinese: 在雕刻中打個嗝可能都會讓你功虧一簣。

definition: to be in overall charge/to oversee
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
protracted (idiom)/long and drawn-out
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
(Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
retort with challenging questions/debate
to spur the horse to full speed (idiom)/to go as fast as possible
lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
law and order/rules and discipline
to purge
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
already too late
